intro: Scandix pinnatifida var. soongorica, commonly known as the Soongorica cowplant, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Central Asia. It is characterized by its branched, spiny stems and compound leaves with a pinnate arrangement. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. This variant is distinguished by its unique morphology and ecological adaptations to its harsh environment.
